results.title: Oil review. No. 10
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Swingler, Greenpark Productions and Anglo Iranian Oil Company
results.brief_description: Magazine film in three sections: “War on winter” - showing modern methods of land clearance in northern Sweden; “Work on wax” - showing how another oil product is finding a multitude of everyday uses; “London’s times” - how oil helps to keep the phenomenal accuracy of the famous Big Ben.

results.title: Oil Review. No. 09
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Swingler, Greenpark Productions and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: The story of the building of a new bridge over the River Karun in South-West Persia. The film shows the difficult nature of the mountain country over which material for the bridge had to be transported. Finally the river is conquered and the strong, delicate steelwork of the bridge spans its summer sloth and its winter torrent, a safe, sure way for all who wish to cross.

results.title: Oil review. No. 05
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. The Gulf run: illustrates the delivery of oil by the SS “Khuzistan” to small ports on the Persian Gulf, a four days journey. 2. Turbo prop tour: the visit to Paris of the British jet-propelled civil airliner, the “Vickers Viscount” including shots whilst in flight, refuelling and landing.

results.title: Oil review. No. 04
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Transfer by road: a story of the moving of a giant new fractionating column from the workshop in which it was made to Grangemouth Refinery, in England. 2. Something small: a story of oil helping Danish farmers to produce more eggs. 3. Made to order: new glass apparatus for the Research Station at Sunbuyry (England) is made on the premises.
